parameters.name: customer_session
parameters.description: The customer session that has been created for the enrollment using the [Create Customer Session](https://docs.y.uno/reference/create-customer-session) endpoint (MAX 64; MIN 36).

account_id.description: The unique identifier of the account. You find this information on [Yuno's Dashboard](https://dashboard.y.uno/).

payment_method_type.description: The payment method type (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Payment Type List](ref:payment-type-list)).

verify.description: Indicates whether to verify the payment with a verify transaction or not. You’ll need to have a provider defined in your CARD route. False by default. Access the [Card Verification](doc:card-verification) page for more details.

vault_on_success.description: Indicates whether to verify the payment with a verify transaction or not. You’ll need to have a provider defined in your CARD route. False by default.

items.example: The merchant has no authorization to use this API.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer, created using the [Create Customer](https://docs.y.uno/reference/create-customer) endpoint (MAX 64; MIN 36).

account_id.description: The unique identifier of the account. You find this information on [Yuno's Dashboard](https://dashboard.y.uno/) (MAX 64; MIN 36).

type.description: The payment method type (MAX 255; MIN 3; [Payment type](ref:payment-type-list)).

workflow.description: The payment workflow indicates whether the integration will use Yuno's SDK or will be a back to back connection. Since you are in the Direct workflow, the value must be `DIRECT`.

provider_data.description: Specifies the provider_data object. This object should only be sent if the merchant requires a token migration process and as long as this has already been agreed with your commercial advisor in Yuno.

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment provider.

payment_method_token.description: The payment method token for the provider specified in `id`.

card_data.description: Specifies the details of the card. Only for `DIRECT` workflow integration.

number.description: Card’s number without any separators (MAX 19; MIN 8) - only available for PCI certified merchants.

expiration_month.description: Card’s expiration month - MM (MAX 2; MIN 2) - only available for PCI certified merchants.

expiration_year.description: Card’s expiration year - YYYY  (MAX 4; MIN 4) - only available for PCI certified merchants.

security_code.description: Card’s security code (MAX 4; MIN 3) - only available for PCI certified merchants.

holder_name.description: Cardholder’s full name as it appears on the card (MAX 26; MIN 3) - only available for PCI certified merchants.

callback_url.description: URL to return the customer after an enrollment in a provider´s environment. Only necessary for alternative payment methods integrations (MAX 255; MIN 3).

verify.description: Indicates whether to verify the payment with a verify transaction or not. You’ll need to have a provider defined in your CARD route. False by default.

vault_on_success.description: Indicates whether to verify the payment with a verify transaction or not. You’ll need to have a provider defined in your CARD route. False by default.
